intro: Echenais sclerantha, commonly known as the rigid sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Montiaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are typically succulent and adapted to arid environments, which helps it conserve water. Echenais sclerantha is often found in rocky soils and is well-suited to high-altitude conditions.
